remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleMonthChanged> event is raised when the user clicks the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> navigation controls to display the next or previous month.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MonthChangedEventArgs>, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MonthChangedEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to specify and code a handler for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleMonthChanged> event that displays in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Label> control whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control has moved forward or backward one month.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to get the month currently displayed by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control and to compare the currently displayed month with another month. For example, you can use this property to calculate the number of months until or since a certain date.
This date is normally the first date of the currently displayed month; however, it can be programmatically changed to any date within the month.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleDate%2A> property can be assigned to this property programmatically to override the month change when the user clicks the navigation controls for the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to compare the months of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MonthChangedEventArgs.NewDate%2A> property and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MonthChangedEventArgs.PreviousDate%2A> property to determine whether the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control moved forward one month or backward one month.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to determine the previously displayed month on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control. You can restore the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control to the previously displayed month by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleDate%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.MonthChangedEventArgs.PreviousDate%2A>.
This date is normally the first date of the previously displayed month; however, it can be programmatically changed to any date within the month.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleDate%2A> property is updated to the date in this property before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleMonthChanged> event is raised.
